Class FilesHandling

java.lang.Object
FilesHandling
public class FilesHandling extends Object
The FilesHandling class handles all file related functions.

  • Method Details

    • loadCustomersFromCSV

      public static void loadCustomersFromCSV(String filePath, HashMap<String,Customer> customersByName, HashMap<Integer,Customer> customersById)
      Loads customer data from a CSV file and populates the provided maps with customer details. Also generates passwords for each customer using the PasswordManager.
      Parameters:
      filePath - The path to the CSV file containing customer data.
      customersByName - A map to store customers, keyed by their full name.
      customersById - A map to store customers, keyed by their ID.

    • updateCSV

      public static void updateCSV(HashMap<String,Customer> customers)
      Updates the customer information in the CSV file after transactions are made.
      Parameters:
      customers - the HashMap of customers whose information needs to be updated

    • generateUserTransactionsFile

      public static void generateUserTransactionsFile(Customer customer, double[] startingBalance, double[] endingBalance, String statementDate)
      Generates a text file containing a summary of the customer's transactions, including account summaries for checking, savings, and credit accounts. The file is named using the customer's first and last name, followed by "_Transactions.txt". Each account type section displays the transaction history or a message indicating no transactions for that account. The file also includes the statement date.
      Parameters:
      customer - The customer whose transaction summary is being generated.
      startingBalance - An array containing the starting balances for each account type.
      endingBalance - An array containing the ending balances for each account type.
      statementDate - The date of the statement to be included in the file.  

    • logTransaction

      public static void logTransaction(String transactionDetails)
      Logs the details of a transaction to a file.
      Parameters:
      transactionDetails - the details of the transaction to be logged
